description: Although limited to small villages, the Russian progress in eastern Ukraine weighs heavily on the population's morale, who anxiously awaits the American presidential election on November 5. The outcome could change the course of the war.
title: War in Ukraine: In the Donbas region, the Russian army inches forward

description: Alexander Zverev will play the Paris Masters final for the second time beating former champion Holger Rune, while Frenchman Ugo Humbert, who downed 2018 champion Karen Khachanov, is reaching his first Masters final at the age of 26.
title: Zverev beats former champion Rune to set up Paris Masters final against Humbert

description: The Democratic candidate in the November 5 presidential election has run a lightning-fast campaign, without managing to distinguish herself from Biden, and without praising the record of the president she has served for the past four years.
title: Kamala Harris struggles to emerge from under Joe Biden's cumbersome shadow

description: With roads, railroads, infrastructure and business areas buried by the disaster that struck Spain's Valencia region, emergency funds have been released. But the total cost is expected to be staggering.
title: 'Incalculable' economic losses in the wake of Spain's floods

description: A popular jury on Thursday sentenced the two killers of activist Marielle Franco, murdered on May 14, 2018, to 78 and 59 years in prison. Six years after her death, her youngest sister is continuing her fight for greater justice.
title: Anielle Franco, Brazil's minister for racial equality: 'Without my sister's death, I wouldn't be here today'

description: Rachida Dati must decide if hams will still be allowed to hang in a tower in this religious building in the Cantal region of southcentral France. It's a bizarre story that questions the relationship between the church, the rural world and the French administration.
title: The French culture minister, a cathedral and its holy hams

description: Representing the right wing of the party, accustomed to controversial comments, the 44-year-old is tasked with turning around a party weakened by its historic defeat in the July elections.
title: Kemi Badenoch, a right-wing politician with no time for 'wokism,' is the new leader of the British Conservatives

description: Negotiations were suspended on Saturday morning after negotiations overran and some delegates had to leave to catch flights.
title: COP16 biodiversity ends without agreement on funding roadmap to rescue nature

description: In the suburbs of Mumbai, I Was A Sari has been employing hundreds of underprivileged women for the past 10 years, making new, contemporary pieces for an international audience from used fabrics.
title: In India, a second life for saris

description: In recent years, the American director's films have been inspired by real-life events, depicting the achievements of individuals, who are transformed into heroes by contemporary showmanship.
title: Clint Eastwood's art of questioning the essence of the Hollywood hero

description: You can enjoy home cooking and raise a glass with friends, in a warm atmosphere and at very reasonable prices. Here are 10 Paris bistros where you want to linger... and return!
title: Ten Parisian bistros where you can really relax

description: Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said in a televised address on Saturday that the disaster was the second deadliest flood in Europe this century and announced a huge increase in the security forces for relief works.
title: Spain sends 10,000 more troops to flood-hit region, as death toll soars to at least 211

description: In a deteriorating economic climate, Europe's second-largest footwear producer is counting on on the modernization of its industry and its expansion into luxury goods to withstand competition from Asia.
title: Portugal's shoe valley is moving upmarket

description: The 'anti-woke' candidate was announced as the replacement for Rishi Sunak on Saturday.
title: Kemi Badenoch elected new leader of UK Conservative party

description: In Chiva, one of the worst-affected towns of the flooding in Valencia that claimed at least 200 lives, a year's worth of rain fell on Tuesday, causing unimaginable damage. The search for survivors is proving difficult, but an impressive show of solidarity is taking shape as residents prepare for the aftermath.
title: Flooding in Spain: Engulfed in mud, shock and agony, the town of Chiva unites in show of solidarity

description: Having eliminated Carlos Alcaraz, the 26-year-old French tennis player qualified for his first Masters semi-final on Friday, beating Australian Jordan Thompson (6-2, 7-6).
title: Paris Masters: No stopping Ugo Humbert, back in the limelight

description: Mobilized 10 years ago against anti-migrant Republican plans, Hispanic activists have climbed the local political ladder and are now at the forefront of Kamala Harris's commitment.
title: 2024 US presidential election: Latinas on the front line of the fight against Trump in Arizona

description: Five teenagers were hit by gunfire in Poitiers on Thursday evening. One of them, aged 15, was declared dead on Saturday morning. A suspect, believed to be involved in drug trafficking, is being sought by police.
title: Shootout in western France leaves one teenager dead

description: Between 2022 and 2023, 162 journalists were killed, nearly half of them working in countries experiencing armed conflict.
title: UNESCO reports surge in journalist killings

description: The deaths of Taylor, 26, and George Floyd, a 46-year-old Black man who was murdered by a white police officer in Minneapolis in May 2020, became the focus of a wave of mass protests in the United States and beyond against racial injustice and police brutality.
title: Former US cop convicted of civil rights abuse in Breonna Taylor case

description: Since Thierry Breton's September resignation, France's seat at the European Commission has been vacant, and will remain so until Stéphane Séjourné succeeds him, in December. Some see this unprecedented situation as a sign of waning influence.
title: For over a month, France has had no European commissioner

description: Strong, sustainable growth, a gigantic mass of consumers, including a 100 million with strong purchasing power. The world's most populous country is increasingly attracting French entrepreneurs, large and small. But the market remains difficult to access, padlocked by monopolies.
title: The French companies betting on India: 'The India of today is the China of 20 years ago'

description: Lebanon's health ministry said 52 people were killed and 72 wounded in Israeli strikes on Friday in the country's eastern Baalbek-Hermel region, attacks for which the Israeli army had not issued evacuation warnings.
title: Lebanon accuses Israel of rejecting truce after Beirut strikes

description: When Le Monde was founded 80 years ago, it quickly picked up on racism in the United States as a key issue to watch. In its early days, the newspaper denounced segregation, while using offensive language to talk about Black Americans.
title: How Le Monde has covered race in the US

description: Amalfi, October 1968. The Italian art critic Germano Celant invited a group of young artists to the Mediterranean coast, where their works in wood, straw or canvas were a real eye-opener. Their work, which he dubbed 'arte povera,' broke all the codes. These three days launched the careers of these visual artists, to whom the Bourse de Commerce in Paris is devoting an exhibition.
title: In 1968, near Naples, arte povera was born, a revolutionary and festive moment

description: In an op-ed for 'Le Monde,' geographer Magali Reghezza warns of major risks posed by climate inaction: Each additional tenth of a degree exponentially increases hydroclimatic extremes.
title: Floods in Spain: 'If global warming continues at its current rate, many areas of the Mediterranean will be uninhabitable'

description: Activists from indigenous and farming communities who live in regions marked by the presence of armed groups, extractive activities and trafficking are the main victims of assassinations.
title: COP16: Colombia, which advocates for 'peace with nature,' is the deadliest country for environmentalists

description: The additional resources build on previous US defense deployments to the Middle East in support of Israel, including a THAAD missile defense system deployed to the country late last month, operated by American troops on the ground.
title: US announces new Middle East military deployments in warning to Iran
